CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 9, 1962, pg. 1 reads: "Dies At Coures - While helping Negro golfers on Monday to familiarize themselves with the Pittsburgh Field Club, scene of the qualifying rounds for the 1962 National Open at Oakmont, Jerry Sumpter, the district's finest golfer, became ill and later was found dead from a heart attack. (Story on Page 5) - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of golfer Jerry Sumpter, wearing light colored short sleeve shirt and pants, with dark belt, swinging golf club possibly at South Park Golf Course
